clinical_study.official_title: Daily Activity Study of Health in Older Sedentary Adults

brief_summary.textblock: In this six-week behavioral intervention, sedentary older adults will receive daily health messaging via their smart phone to better understand their daily activities and emotions. Participants undergo structural and functional brain imaging before and after the intervention along with measures of their behavioral, emotional and thinking functions.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in activity at six weeks compared to baseline
primary_outcome.description: Participants' daily activity measured by wearable devices

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in structural and functional brain connectivity at six weeks compared to baseline
primary_outcome.description: Functional (resting-state and task-based) and structural MRI brain measures

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in cognitive functioning at six weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Executive function, complex attention and processing speed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in affective processing at six weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of affect and mood (i.e., geriatric depression scale)

arm_group.description: Brain MRI and Motivational Behavioral Intervention
Brain MRI and Control Behavioral Intervention

intervention.description: Motivational messaging delivered during a functional brain MRI scan and with daily messaging
Control messaging delivered during a functional brain MRI scan and with daily messaging

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being able to speak English fluently
- Body Mass Index (BMI) between 20 and 40
- Normal or corrected-normal vision based on the minimal 20/20 standard
- Ambulatory without pain or the assistance of walking devices
- No diagnosis of a neurological disease
- No contraindications to MRI imaging
- Exercising less than 75 minutes per week (half of the recommended 150 minutes per week)
- Regular access to a computer with internet or smartphone
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current diagnosis of a Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-V) Axis I or II disorder including Major Depression
- History of major psychiatric illness including schizophrenia (not including general anxiety disorder or depression)
- Current treatment for cancer - except non-melanoma skin
- Neurological condition (multiple sclerosis, Parkinson's disease, dementia, mild cognitive impairment) or brain injury (traumatic or stroke)
- Type I Diabetes
- Current alcohol or substance abuse
- Current treatment for congestive heart failure, angina, uncontrolled arrhythmia, deep vein thrombosis or other cardiovascular event
- Myocardial infarction, coronary artery bypass grafting, angioplasty or other cardiac condition in the past year
- Current use of beta blockers
- Regular use of an assisted walking device
- Claustrophobia
- Not passing the Telephone Interview of Cognitive Status (TICS) as normal
- Use of any anti-psychotic, anti-depressant, anti-anxiety, and attention deficit disorder (ADD/ADHD) medications.
- Not fluent in English
- Contraindications to MRI
- No regular access to a computer with internet or smartphone
